title: New Gaming PC ; ibuypower bb951, cant figure out why I am lagging and its slow please help!

embed.description: iBUYPOWER Desktop - Intel Core i5 - 16GB Memory - NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 - 1TB Hard Drive + 120GB Solid State Drive: 16GB DDR4 SDRAM memory; 120GB solid state drive; 1TB hard drive; HDMI output; high-speed wireless LAN

body: I need some help, i get random big lag spikes, going from 150ms -7k+ Ms.. i have my setting on low.. just spent 1200$ on this pc and really dont see how it it lagging with league. Please help.

replies.body:
Hey Amenad√¨el,

NIce on getting a new rig, I'm always super happy when I hear someone's picks up new hardware--especially a whole new PC. It sucks that you're having issues lagging though; a few questions really quickly:

1. Does your old system run League of Legends without any connection issues? If so, it's more likely the new computer we'll look into than your home network.
2. Are you using a wired connection? A wired one generally works more consistently than a wireless one for a variety of reasons.
3. Have you updated all of your network drivers? The software and drivers that are responsible for your wired and wireless connection. (unfortunately, I cannot find something specifically for your system because the product page doesn't mention what your network card's brand and model are)
4. Have you tried power cycling your modem and router? All it means it unplugging your modem and router from power, waiting for a few minutes, and then plugging them back in; modem first, then router. Though not as typical anymore, some older networks behave oddly when new hardware is connected (usually negatively affecting the new hardware) until the network has been restarted.

Besides that, you might want to check out our [Connections support article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues), it has a few steps that may help you achieve connection bliss (some have been mentioned already)

If you still continue having issues, reach out to one of my colleagues by sending a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). When sending a ticket, [logs will be a great help](http://bit.ly/2thtj6h)!
i find that half the time someone comes to me with this issue there computer is set to used some shitty motherboard graphics gpu instead of the actual gpu they paid all the money for
